result.name: european-regional-development-fund-2000-2006-closure-database
result.notes: This database is an electronic file containing details of potential and confirmed liabilities arising from irregularities in the European Regional Development Fund in England for the period 2000-2006

organization.name: department-for-communities-and-local-government
organization.title: Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government
organization.description:
The Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government's (formerly the Department for Communities and Local Government) job is to create great places to live and work, and to give more power to local people to shape what happens in their area.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/ministry-of-housing-communities-and-local-government

result.title: European Regional Development Fund 2000-2006 Closure Database

extras.value: It is not appropriate to release this information, some of which is highly sensitive.  Inaccurate media coverage of DCLG's liabilities in the 2009-10 accounts arising from 2000-06 ERDF Programme closure led to consideration of whether information on irregularities should be published.  This would have demonstrated that DCLG had the final responsibility for some of the irregularities and that not all of them were the result of unreasonable enforcement of regulations by the European Commission.  Advice from legal, data protection and communications colleagues at the time was that publication of such detail was inadvisable because of various legal and practical barriers.  The proposal then was that a more detailed explanation of the liabilities should be included in the press release accompanying the publication of DCLG's accounts which would not identify individual grant recipients but would list where the fault lay with the Department and where it lay with projects but could not be recovered.  This approach was agreed by David Rossington and Sir Bob Kerslake.
